snippet: New York State attorney general Eric T. Schneiderman cannot hire so much as an extra secretary without approval from the Division of the Budget, which is controlled by the not so invariably helpful governor.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column; New York Attorney Gen Eric T Schneiderman and Gov Andrew M Cuomo diverge sharply on what to do with $613 million JP Morgan Chase has agreed to pay New York State in mortgage-related settlement; Schneiderman wants to use money to write down thousands of troubled mortgages, while Cuomo aides hint that money should get funneled into state treasury to help pay for thick menu of election year tax cuts.
lead_paragraph: New York State attorney general Eric T. Schneiderman cannot hire so much as an extra secretary without approval from the Division of the Budget, which is controlled by the not so invariably helpful governor.

headline.main: New York’s Mortgage Bank Hunter May Not Be Able to Direct His Spoils
headline.print_headline: New York’s Mortgage Bank Hunter May Not Be Able to Direct His Spoils
